text:
Applying changes to a testplan should be consistantly done across the interface.
There seems to be 2 distinct times where it applies changes. 

The first is like in the arguments of an IF contoller, when I change the data it
is automanically applied to the testplan if I make a mistake there is no turning
back. This is the type I perfer because it is most like other applications. 

The second is similar to HTML call parameters in where if I do not press return
the change is not made. This is annoying because if I am changing several calls
then I may just click on each one with the mouse changing them and not pressing
the return key expecting the fact I changed the value to be reflected in the
testcase. This also happens in user parameters. Several times I have changed the
value and ran a testplan to find out that the paramter change did not happen
because I did not press return afterward.
